newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent steadies at lower levels, awaits U.S..
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent steadies at lower levels, awaits U.S..

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures steadied on Thursday after opening lower as the market caught up with a late sell-off in the U.S. after the Brent and gas oil markets closed, traders said.
May Brent was 21 cents a barrel lower at 1234 GMT and was trading at $18.30 a barrel. April IPE gas oil was $2 a tonne weaker at $163.50 a tonne, after having been called $4 to $5 lower.
"Nothing really new is happening, it is very quiet," said Fenella Graham at MeesPierson Derivatives in London. "We opened in line with the late falls in the U.S.
"But it is extra boring so far today," she said, adding that because of the extent of Wednesday's falls, traders were uncertain of current direction and were waiting for U.S. markets to open.
Brent entered fresh territory on Wednesday after it forged through significant support levels to create new nine-month lows.
"Essentially the availability of crude cargoes, including the North Sea and West African barrels, is simply too high," GNI research said in a daily report.
"Refinery runs have been rising after turnarounds but this has been nowhere near enough to soak up the excess crude."

April gas oil was also steady at lower levels and Graham saw it bound in a tight range between $162.75 and $163.50, with a good chance of remaining between those levels at least until U.S. markets opened.
